qa.name: Whiskers
qa.appearance: Fluffy orange tabby with a glowing collar

json_to_edit.voice_over: One small paw for a cat, one giant leap for feline-kind.
json_to_edit.description: Whiskers, the time-traveling cat, materializes in ancient Egypt, ready to change history.
json_to_edit.ambience_sound_keywords: Bustling crowd, animal noises, distant construction
json_to_edit.name: Feline Time Meddler
json_to_edit.scene_summary: A time-traveling cat appears in ancient Egypt and inadvertently changes the course of history.

qa.action: Whiskers materializes in a flash of light amidst a busy ancient Egyptian marketplace.

hf.action: The cat's glowing collar catches the attention of nearby merchants and shoppers.

tr.action: Whiskers' curious eyes scan the unfamiliar surroundings, tail twitching with excitement.

xc.action: The cat darts between the legs of workers carrying stone blocks for pyramid construction.

ka.action: Whiskers jumps onto a scribe's table, paw prints smudging fresh hieroglyphics.

fn.sfx_keywords: time machine powering up, wind whooshing
fn.action: The cat's collar glows brightly as Whiskers prepares to jump to another time period.

edit_command: Remove every second shot from the scene, but don't change anything else.

updated_json.voice_over: One small paw for a cat, one giant leap for feline-kind.
updated_json.description: Whiskers, the time-traveling cat, materializes in ancient Egypt, ready to change history.
updated_json.ambience_sound_keywords: Bustling crowd, animal noises, distant construction
updated_json.name: Feline Time Meddler
updated_json.scene_summary: A time-traveling cat appears in ancient Egypt and inadvertently changes the course of history.

label.rationale: we will remove every second shot from the scene as requested, while keeping all other elements of the json unchanged. this means we'll remove shots with keys "hf", "xc", and "fn", which are the second, fourth, and sixth shots respectively. we'll update the "list_display_order" accordingly and adjust the "number_of_shots" to reflect the new total. all other information in the json will remain the same.
